title: Website pages not loading in Firefox
content:
Hi,

For some reason some web pages of my website are not loading in Firefox i have tried several times, it shows error. It's loading perfectly fine on google and internet explorer. Here are the pages A2 Curd and A2 Milk.

Thanks in advance
creator: nativemilkindia

title: I'm Getting "Use your Google Account to Sign in to..."
content:
I've been getting a PopUp recently (upper right corner below bookmarks toolbar) titled "Sign in with Google" saying "Use your Google Account to Sign in to...". I've followed the instructions on the internet to access my Google account and turn off this security setting (Google Account sign-in prompts) and it still appears. This does not happen on other chromium browsers I regularly use.

Why does Firefox keep displaying this PopUp, and more importantly, how can I suppress this annoyance?

Thanks,

Firefox v107.0 (64-bit) - up to date Windows 10 Pro (fully updated) Running NordVPN.
creator: BPaul_H

title: Computer memory used by FireFox
content: In Windows task manager, it shows Firefox using 863.9MG (it was up to 1,4485.6MB a while ago) of memory with 17 Firefox files listed under the Firefox heading. What is this? Why is it using so much memory?
creator: hedeli0812

title: My new Lenovo laptop running Windows 11 Pro with Firefox Browser will not open this URL: https://app.weaveeducation.com/login
content:
My new Lenovo laptop running Windows 11 Pro with updated Firefox Browser will not open this URL: https://app.weaveeducation.com/login When I attempt to log in, a large circular image spins around for just a few seconds and the everything stops.

The same URL will run on my Windows 10 Home machine using Firefox just fine.

Just wonder if there is something I may be able to change to get this URL to open on the Windows 11 Pro machine?

Thanks so much. Howard Kuchta Lawton, Oklahoma hkuchta@sbcglobal.net Retired Educator
creator: hkuchta

title: How to disable restore session when reboot computer
content:
I disable my option "Restore previous session" and it works fine if i close my firefox.

But if i do not close my firefox and reboot my computer directive, the session will restore at next startup.

Obviously when i reboot my computer, I don't want to see my tabs anymore, but I failed to find any setting to do so. I also find someone say to set `browser.sessionstore.resume_from_crash` in `about:config`, but it doesn't work, and I don't think it is the proper way to solve this problem because reboot is not crash.

OS: linux firefox: 107
creator: slow_d

title: Rally asks me to complete my enrollment every time I start Firefox
content:
I enrolled in "Rally" some time ago and participated in a few studies. Suddenly, every time I start Firefox, it puts up a page telling me I haven't completed my Rally enrollment. (https://rally.mozilla.org/rally-required/index.html) If I click on the button, "Complete Enrollment," I am simply taken to a page that says there are no available studies.

Not even slightly debilitating, but certainly annoying! Anybody have a suggestion?
creator: BSquared

title: Yahoo Mail
content:
After the latest version of Fire Fox was installed, my yahoo email no longer works as before. Emails show up and can be read but that's all. Can't delete, reply to, access contacts, settings etc. Basically everything along that line of functions is inop. When using MS Edge to access yahoo mail everything is fine. And, everything was fine with the previous version of Fire Fox. Can I go back to that previous version or can this be fixed?

Thanks for your help.....
creator: reillybonchien

title: I am missing the Minimize and Exit icons in the top Tab
content: I am not able to minimize or Exit out of the Firefox browser--There are no icons on the top banner to click on when I have to exit the browser.
